intro: Kickxia dichondrifolia, commonly known as the two-leaf flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Its foliage is covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Kickxia dichondrifolia is a perennial herb that is relatively uncommon and often grows in isolated populations.
